intro: Pachynema, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, lance-shaped appearance. Pachynema species are often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
